quiz.title: Algebra 2: Unit 14 Quiz 1
quiz.subtitle: 14.1: Matrix Operations: Addition, Subtraction, Scalar Multiplication
quiz.subject: Mathematics

questions.question: What is the requirement for adding two matrices together?
options: They must have the same dimensions.
They must both be square matrices.
The number of columns in the first must match the rows in the second.
They must contain only positive integers.
questions.explanation: Matrix addition is performed element-wise, so the matrices must have identical dimensions for every element to have a corresponding partner.

questions.question: If matrix $A$ is $3 \times 2$ and matrix $B$ is $2 \times 3$, what is the result of $A + B$?
questions.explanation: Since a $3 \times 2$ matrix and a $2 \times 3$ matrix do not have the same dimensions, they cannot be added.

questions.question: In matrix $A$, what does the notation $a_{21}$ represent?
options: The element in the second row and the first column.
The element in the first row and the second column.
The product of the first row and second column.
questions.explanation: Standard matrix notation uses $a_{ij}$ where $i$ is the row index and $j$ is the column index.

questions.question: Perform scalar multiplication: $3 \times \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -1 \\ 0 & 4 \end{bmatrix}$.
questions.explanation: Every element inside the matrix is multiplied by the scalar 3.

questions.question: What is the dimension of a matrix with 4 rows and 1 column?
questions.explanation: Dimensions are always stated as Rows $\times$ Columns.

questions.question: Which property of real numbers does NOT apply to matrix addition?
options: All of these apply to matrix addition.
Associative Property ($(A + B) + C = A + (B + C)$)
questions.explanation: Matrix addition behaves very similarly to regular addition; it is both commutative and associative, and an additive identity (the zero matrix) exists.

questions.question: If $2A = \begin{bmatrix} 10 & -4 \\ 6 & 0 \end{bmatrix}$, what is matrix $A$?
questions.explanation: To find $A$, divide every element in the matrix by the scalar 2.

questions.question: Calculate $A + B$ where $A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 2 \end{bmatrix}$ and $B = \begin{bmatrix} -1 \\ 5 \end{bmatrix}$.
questions.explanation: $1 + (-1) = 0$ and $2 + 5 = 7$. The result remains a $2 \times 1$ column matrix.

questions.question: What is a 'zero matrix'?
options: A matrix where every element is 0.
A matrix with 0 rows and 0 columns.
A matrix that has no solution.
A matrix with a determinant of 0.
questions.explanation: A zero matrix is the additive identity for matrices; adding it to any matrix $A$ results in matrix $A$.

scoreMessages.90: Perfect! You have a solid understanding of basic matrix arithmetic.
scoreMessages.70: Good job. Be careful with negative numbers during subtraction.
scoreMessages.50: Remember that dimensions must match exactly for addition and subtraction.
scoreMessages.0: Review the Row $\times$ Column format and basic element-wise operations.
